sub_category: DIY Gifts That Will Leave Your Mom Awestruck This Mother's Day
sub_category_description:
Mother’s day is almost here, and what better than to surprise your mother with DIY gifts! If you are looking for some inspiration, we are here to help.

Finding a perfect gift can be as challenging as solving Da Vinci’s cryptex. It’s even more difficult when we are all stuck at home battling a pandemic. And let’s be honest, spending money does not particularly seem like a good idea either. Moreover, the joy of seeing your mother’s eyes water at the sight of something handmade is priceless. Worry not, you can still surprise your wonder woman with a gift, even if you lack master DIY skills. Here are some #DIYMothersDayGiftIdeas that will help clear the fog.

post_content:
View this post on Instagram

Have you ever wondered if our projects are easy for children? Well check out Fox! He is 4 and rockin’ it!! 🙌🏻 If he can do it, so can you! Want to do something creative with your children? Comment YES and I will send you info on our kits!🤗 . . . #phyllisddesigns #diycrafting #farmhousedecor #diycrafts #easycrafts #easycraftsforkids #craftsforkids #diyhomedecor #familycraftnight #familycrafts #instacrafts #instacraft #craftersofinstagram #cricutprojects #cricutmade

A post shared by Phyllis D Designs (@phyllisd.designs) on May 4, 2020 at 3:12pm PDT

Take a cue from Phyllis D Designs (@phyllisd.designs) and give your mom this amazing DIY painting. The no-hassle sign can go on your parent’s bedroom door to remind all children that superheroes need a break, too.

post_content:
View this post on Instagram

How to keep your bath bombs from splitting ✌🏻 Seriously how did this take me so long to figure out? Do NOT let them dry in the molds over night. Leave a crater in one side and an excess mound in the other for a nice connection in the middle. Enjoy babes!

A post shared by Kristin (@the.oilsaurus.momma) on May 10, 2019 at 5:38pm PDT

Use Kristin’s (@theoilsaurus.momma) trick to make the perfect bath bombs. Treating your mother to some relaxing self-care time is one of the best things you can do for her.

post_content:
View this post on Instagram

Esta idea es definitivamente una de mis favoritas para regalo el día de las madres. Me parece tierna y me encanta el sentimiento de mantenerlos chiquitos de alguna manera... para mi es algo que mantendré para siempre ✨ las puedes usar como joyero, o simplemente decoración en tu tocador. Tome fotos del proceso (me falto el último paso que es el mod podge para cellar y darle brillo, porque no me a llegado de Amazon, lo agregaré cuando llegue.) lo único que necesitas para hacer este proyecto es barro, rodillo, un lápiz, algo para cortar como un cuchillo, agua, un globo o algo redondo para poner las manitas a secar y que tomen forma curveada, mod podge para cellar y tu la puedes decorar a tu gusto. Yo use pintura y flores secas. También puedes dejar que tus hijos las decoren 💕 con Emma me fue más difícil tracear su manitas porque se movía mucho pero igual me encanta lo pequeñita que se mira 💕 #diy #diyjewelerydish #diymothersdaygift #sweetgifts #tokeepforever #sentimentalgifts #mothersdaygift #smallhands #clay #clayart #keepthemlittle #keepthemlittleforever #keepthemlittlelonger #regalosechosamano #diadelasmadres

A post shared by Yeni Lopez (@boxofhappy.times) on May 2, 2020 at 2:01pm PDT

Wanna spike the cuteness chart? Try these hand-shaped bowls we found on Yeni Lopez’s (@boxofhappy.time) profile. Bowls shaped like your hand are totally going to score you some brownie points.

View this post on Instagram

Every year our students prepare a very special surprise to celebrate Mother's Day! Kids love to give something they made. They feel really proud about it! ❤️ This year each student painted a small flower pot and chose a miniature succulent for it. It was such an amazing gift that one of our students gave it to her mom but took it back! Lol 😝 #happymothersday #mothersday #diy #diymothersdaygift #mothersdaysurprise #mothersdaygift #succulovers #succulent #gardening #kidsdiy #miniaturesucculent

A post shared by It's Playtime (@itsplaytimeingles) on May 16, 2017 at 4:54am PDT

It's Playtime (@itsplaytimeingles) will teach you to pot and decorate succulents for your momma. What better gift than something that can keep her company in the kitchen, living room, and even at her work desk?

DIY Mother’s Day gift❤️ #DIY #mothersdaygifts #diygifts #diymothersdaygift #stringart

A post shared by J👑 (@jxbnvsta) on May 11, 2019 at 5:57pm PDT

If you are out of fancy supplies to make bath bombs or hand-made soaps. Grab a slab of ply from the garage and some nails. Now get stringing them to create art. You can even attach pictures to this to make it memorable as @jxbnvsta did.

post_content:
View this post on Instagram

Need a last minute Mother's Day gift? Make your own fruit bouquet! 🍓🍍 All you need is fresh fruit, wooden skewers, and a Mason jar. Cut up her favorite fruit, stick each piece on a skewer, and arrange in the jar. You'll save lots of money and homemade is always better! Happy Mother's Day to all the moms and may it be a peaceful day for all who are not with them today. ❤️

A post shared by Bri Blank Alexander 🍓 (@bri.healthy) on May 8, 2016 at 9:05am PDT

Here’s a gift that takes only minutes to make, thanks to Bri Blank Alexander (@bri.healthy). Grab some fruits and pop them on wooden skewers to make a fancy fruit bouquet. You can even make a cupcake or donut bouquet.
